question:
Q1. In the following URL, what channel grouping is traffic assigned to?
`example.com/?utm_source=google&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=315`
Q2. If you want to evaluate if direct traffic delivered more traffic than organic search in August 2019, which report do you look at?
Q3. What is the relationship between an event and an event goal?
options: Nothing, an event is another name for event goal.
An event is captured per user; an event goal is captured per session.
An event goal must be created in order to track events.
An event is a user interaction; an event goal is triggered by a selected event.

question: Q4. A user downloads a white paper with event tracking once in a single session. Another user downloads the same white paper three times in a single session. How many unique events are counted?

options: to change the way the data table is displayed
to compare data to previous periods

options: all the views of that property
all the accounts in the organization

question: Q20. Of the following segments, which represents the highest value audience?

options: Hit: Download // Event: Sample Tone // Content: Music
Category: Music // Action: Download // Label: Sample Tone
Category: Download // Event: Music // Label: Sample Tone
Hit: Music // Event: Download //Content: Sample Tone

options: An event goal must be created in order to track events.

question: Q29. When configuring the global site tag, where in the HTML should it be placed?

options:
Create a search and replace filter.

Q32. You already have Google Analytics set up on your website, but decide to add Google Tag Manager. What do you do with the existing Analytics tag?
options: Move the tag to just before `</head>`.
Move the tag to just before `</body>`.

question: Q33. How do you review the revenue and conversion rate between your traffic sources?
options: Create two segments, one for revenue and one for conversion rate, and then review Acquisition > All Traffic.
View Ecommerce > Overview and toggle Traffic Sources in the Explorer tab.
Create two segments, one for revenue and one for conversion rate, and then review Conversions > Ecommerce.
Go to All Traffic > Source Medium and set eCommerce in the Conversions menu.

question: Q34. Which calculated metric would return average events per user?

a segment to exclude traffic to the hostname
a segment to exclude traffic from IP addresses
a filter to exclude traffic from IP addresses

options: one pageview for /contact/ and one pageview for /CONTACT/

question: Q49. What is the hierarchy between sessions, users, and hits?

Q53. It is September, and you want to evaluate the most popular page on your site for the month of August. What first steps would you take?
options: 1. Set Date Range to Last 30 Days. 2. Visit Behavior > Site Content > All Pages.
1. Set Date Range to Last 30 Days. 2. Visit Behavior > Site Content > Content Drilldown.
1. Set Date Range to Last Month. 2. Visit Behavior > Site Content > Content Drilldown.
1. Set Date Range to Last Month. 2. Visit Behavior > Site Content > All Pages.

question: Q54. This report is sorted by bounce rate in ascending order. How do you view these results in order of importance instead?

playing a video before signing up

question: Q57. What parameter should you use if you were tracking different versions of an ad?

Q60.If you want to quickly see what days and times were most popular for visiting your site, what do you do?
options: Go to Home > Users by time of day (Widget)
Go to the report at Audience > Cohort Analysis and toggle By Day.
Go to Behavior > Engagement and toggle Hourly.
Create a pivot table by Hour on Site Content > All Pages.

question: Q61. If your site does not attribute transactions to the original source, but instead shows all transactions attributed to your payment processor (for example Stripe, PayPal, or Square), how do you remedy this issue?
options: Use a search and replace filter.

options: yes, by viewing in page analytics

Q69. You are tracking events of playback of video on the home page of a website. You want users who watch the video, but still leave the page with no additional pageviews or interactions, to still be included in the bounce rate calculation. What must be configured?
Q70. Which attribution model does Google Analytics apply by default for standard reports?
Q71. If you want to track one destination goal but have two URLs that could trigger the goal (for example,/thank-you and /checkout-complete), what approach can you use?
options: Create a content grouping, and then use the group as the destination.
Add the additional page as a funnel step.
Use a regular expression when adding the goal destination.

question: Q72. If you created a calculated metric that returned a value of "80" with Time as the formatting type, how would it be represented in Google Analytics?
Q73. You want to compare the revenue, top products, and average order value between people who viewed three or more pages on your site, to those who viewed fewer. What do you do?
options: Create a custom report where Page Depth is >/3 or Page Depth is <3. Toggle on Revenue, Top Products, and Average Order Value as Dimensions.
View the Product Performance report and add Page Depth as a secondary dimension. Create a table filter for Page Depth greater than 3 and Page Depth less than 3.
Create a custom segment where Page Depth is >/3 and another segment where Page Depth is <3. Apply both segments while on the Ecommerce Overview report.
View the Ecommerce Overview report and create a table filter where Page Depth is >/3 or Page Depth is <3.

question: Q74. If you wanted to create a user-defined metric to measure Revenue per User, what would you use?
